page.title: 17URCHFONT VILLAGE POND
page.content: URCHFONT IS ONE OF THE FEW VILLAGES TO STILL HAVE A POND. IT BACKS ONTO A FARMYARD WALL AND HAS GRASS ON THREE SIDES. I IS ABOUT A HUNDRED YEARS OLD AND WAS ORIGINALLY KEPT FILLED BY WATER THROWN FROM THE FARM AFTER COOLING THE MILK FROM THE COWS, NOW IT IS PURELY SURFACE WATER WITH OCCASIONAL WATER PUMPED IN FROM THE FARM BOREHOLE IN DRY WEATHER. A LOCAL RESIDENT HAS TAKEN IT UPON HIMSELFTO LOOK AFTER THE DUCKS WHICH HAVE SETTLED THERE, ABOUT A HUNDRED MALLARDS AND HALF A DOZEN CROSS BREEDS. HE AND OTHER VOLUNTEERS CUT THE GRASS AND KEEP THE AREA CLEAN AND TIDY WHICH HELPED URCHFONT TO WIN THE BEST KEPT VILLAGE COMPETITION. ONCE IT WAS NEARLY FILLED IN TO MAKE A CAR PARK FOR THE CHURCH, BUT FORTUNATELY THE POND WON.
